main event: Multiple witnesses, including Captain Charles H. McMahon and S/Sgt Lovett G. Harrell, observed a bright light and unidentified flying object over Robins Air Force Base, Georgia on April 10, 1950.
interesting points: The object was observed for about 4-5 minutes while moving in a controlled manner,The object approached from the South and had red and white glowing rims,The size was comparable to a medium-sized automobile,There were no sounds or odors associated with the object,The object made sharp turns and gained altitude rapidly during the observation.
sighted object: a bright, glowing object with red and white rims
witness description: Captain Charles H. McMahon and S/Sgt Lovett G. Harrell, both affiliated with the Station Hospital at Robins Air Force Base.
